getAMDisplayLabelName

public static java.lang.String getAMDisplayLabelName(oracle.jbo.server.ApplicationModuleDefImpl amDefImpl)
Method to get Application Module Display name of given ApplicationModuleDefImpl. This method takes care of finding the Display Name from Personalized ApplicationModuleDefImpl when if not found in the standard ApplicationModuleDefImpl. If no Display Name is set for the passed ApplicationModuleDefImpl, the AM name is returned.

Parameters:
amDefImpl - - ApplicationModuleDefImpl of the AM
Returns:
String - Application Module Display name

getViewObjectDisplayLabelName

public static java.lang.String getViewObjectDisplayLabelName(oracle.jbo.server.ViewDefImpl viewDefImpl)
Method to get View Object Display name of given ViewDefImpl. This method takes care of finding the Display Name from Personalized ViewDefImpl when if not found in the standard ViewDefImpl. If no Display Name is set for the passed ViewDefImpl, the ViewObject name is returned.

Parameters:
viewDefImpl - - ViewDefImpl of the VO
Returns:
String - View Object Display name

getAttributeDisplayLabelName

public static java.lang.String getAttributeDisplayLabelName(oracle.jbo.AttributeDef attributeDef)
Method to get View Object Attribute Display name of given AttributeDef. This method does NOT take care of finding the Personalized AttributeDef because that needs to be explicity derived from the parent Personalized ViewDefImpl. If no Label is set in the passed AttributeDef, the attribute name is returned.

Parameters:
attributeDef - - AttributeDef of the attribute
Returns:
String - View Object Attribute Display name

isExpertModeVO

public static boolean isExpertModeVO(oracle.jbo.server.ViewDefImpl viewDef)
***Internal Use Only*** Determine if the VO passed is in Expert Mode Query mode

Parameters:
viewDef - : View Definition Implementation
Returns:
true/false based on whether it is Expert mode or not

Parameters:
userDate - date to be converted(yyyy-MM-dd).
hours - hours to set
mins - minutes to set
secs - seconds to set
Returns:

                                       java.lang.String toDate)
Calculate number of days between dates. If any of date is null then current date is considered.

Parameters:
fromDate - from date.
toDate - to Date.
Returns:
number of days between dates.
